name.text: Identifying and Determining the Surface Area of a Conical Container

questiontext.text:
A conical container is open at the bottom and is made of metal. The container has a base radius of \({@base_radius_of_the_cone@}\,\text{cm}\) and a vertical height of \({@height_of_the_cone@}\,\text{cm}\), as shown in the diagram below.

[[jsxgraph]] const brd = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard(divid, { boundingbox: [-6, 12, 6, -2], // (xmin, ymax, xmax, ymin) axis: false, showNavigation: false, showCopyright: false }); // Cone parameters const radius = 4; // 5 cm (visual units) const height = 9; // 8 cm (visual units) // Center of base and apex const O = brd.create('point', [0, 0], {visible: false}); const Apex = brd.create('point', [0, height], {visible: false}); // Ellipse params for perspective: horizontal a = radius, vertical b = radius * factor const a = radius; const b = radius * 0.35; // flatten factor for nice perspective // Points on ellipse (left & right) const left = brd.create('point', [-a, 0], {visible: false}); const right = brd.create('point', [a, 0], {visible: false}); // Back half of ellipse (hidden) - dashed brd.create('curve', [ function(t) { return O.X() + a * Math.cos(t); }, function(t) { return O.Y() + b * Math.sin(t); }, 0, Math.PI ], {strokeColor: '#222', dash: 2, strokeWidth: 2}); // Front half of ellipse (visible) - solid brd.create('curve', [ function(t) { return O.X() + a * Math.cos(t); }, function(t) { return O.Y() + b * Math.sin(t); }, Math.PI, 2 * Math.PI ], {strokeColor: '#222', strokeWidth: 2}); // Cone sides (Apex to left & right) brd.create('segment', [Apex, left], {strokeColor: '#222', strokeWidth: 3}); brd.create('segment', [Apex, right], {strokeColor: '#222', strokeWidth: 3}); // Fill visible triangular face (Apex-left-right) with nice color // Note: polygon [left, Apex, right] keeps ordering so fill doesn't cross the ellipse brd.create('polygon', [left, Apex, right], { fillColor: '#ff5a8a', // pretty pink fillOpacity: 0.9, borders: {strokeColor: '#c2185b', strokeWidth: 2} }); // Draw the vertical height line (Apex to center) brd.create('segment', [Apex, O], {strokeColor: '#111', strokeWidth: 1.5, dash: 2}); // Draw radius line (center to right) and add double arrow heads // Use an arrow from O to right, and another from right to O to simulate ↔ brd.create('arrow', [O, right], {strokeColor: '#111', strokeWidth: 1.6, lastArrow:{type:2,size:6}}); brd.create('arrow', [right, O], {strokeColor: '#111', strokeWidth: 1.6, lastArrow:{type:2,size:6}}); // Right-angle square at the base center (between height and radius) // Small square with corner at (0,0) const s = 0.6; // square size (visual) const p1 = brd.create('point', [0 + s, 0], {fixed:true, visible: false}); const p2 = brd.create('point', [s, s], {fixed:true,visible: false}); const p3 = brd.create('point', [0, s], {fixed:true,visible: false}); brd.create('polygon', [O, p1, p2, p3], { fillColor: '#ffeb3b', // yellow box fillOpacity: 0.95, borders: {strokeColor: '#444', strokeWidth: 1} }); // Labels: radius (5 cm) — place slightly above the radius line brd.create('text', [a/2 - 0.6, -0.4, '{#base_radius_of_the_cone#} cm'], {fontSize: 16, fontFamily: 'Arial'}); // Label: height (8 cm) — place mid way along vertical brd.create('text', [0.4, height/2 + 0.4, '{#height_of_the_cone#} cm'], {fontSize: 16, fontFamily: 'Arial'}); // Optional: slanted edge label (if you want slant labelled, uncomment below) brd.create('text', [ (a)/2 + 0.5, (height)/2, 'L ' ], {fontSize: 14}); [[/jsxgraph]]

Using the information given above:

  1. Identify the slant height of the conical container.

    \(\text{Slant height(L)}=\)[[input:ans1]]\(\,\text{cm}\)[[validation:ans1]][[feedback:prt1]]

  2. Determine the total surface area of metal sheet required to construct the container, correct to \(\text{three decimal places}\).

    \(\text{Total surface area of metal sheet}=\)[[input:ans2]]\(\,\text{cm}^2\)[[validation:ans2]][[feedback:prt2]]

generalfeedback.text:
We are given a conical container that is open at the bottom. The base radius of the cone is \({@base_radius_of_the_cone@}\,\text{cm}\) and the vertical height is \({@height_of_the_cone@}\,\text{cm}\).

The diagram shows that the radius, height, and slant height form a right-angled triangle.

  1. Identifying the slant height of the cone

    Using Pythagoras’ theorem:

    \( \text{(Slant height)}^2 = (\text{radius})^2 + (\text{height})^2 \)

    \( \begin{align} L^2 &= {@base_radius_of_the_cone@}^2 + {@height_of_the_cone@}^2 \\ L^2 &= ({@base_radius_of_the_cone@})^2 + ({@height_of_the_cone@})^2 \\ L &= \sqrt{({@base_radius_of_the_cone@})^2 + ({@height_of_the_cone@})^2}\\ &= {@slantheight_of_the_cone@}\,\text{cm} \end{align} \)

    From the given values, the slant height is:
    \( L = {@slantheight_of_the_cone@}\,\text{cm} \)

  2. Determining the total surface area of metal sheet required

    Since the container is open at the bottom, only the curved surface area is required.

    The formula for the curved surface area of a cone is:

    \( \text{Curved surface area} = \pi r l \)

    Substituting the given values:
    \( \begin{align} \text{Surface Area} &= \pi \times {@base_radius_of_the_cone@} \times {@slantheight_of_the_cone@} \\ &= \frac{22}{7} \times {@base_radius_of_the_cone@} \times {@slantheight_of_the_cone@} \\ &= \frac{22}{7} \times {@R_times_l@} \\ &={@area_1@}\\ &= {@Area_cone@}\,\text{cm}^2 \end{align} \)

    Therefore, the total surface area of metal sheet required is:
    \( \boxed{{@Area_cone@}\,\text{cm}^2} \)

questionnote.text:
\(\text{The radius and the Vertical height of the conical container are}\, {@base_radius_of_the_cone@}\,\text{cm} \,\text{and}\,{@height_of_the_cone@}\text{cm}\,\text{respectively}.\)

\(\text{The slant height of the conical container}={@slantheight_of_the_cone@}\,\text{cm}\)

\(\text{The Total surface area of the canonical container}={@Area_cone@}\,\text{cm}^2\)
